column4: I did a fresh install of Ubuntu 10.04, but my network card doesn't seem to be recognized. lspci returns the broadcom interface, but dmesg doesn't show anything related to the card at boot.
I have also ran all updates and upgraded to the latest kernel using apt-offline, because I figured the driver would be in the release, but that didn't help either.
Install aditional driver. Go system -> Adminitration -> Aditional drivers. See if you have anything to install.
but I'll download the deb, sec.
that also isn't the chipset of the driver I need, does that matter?
In another machine thar connects. $apt-get install -d b43-fwcutter. copy the .deb and $dpkg -i package in the server.
That is the only driver i used with broadcom. I dont know for sure.
doesn't seem to be covered under the BCM43xx list.
You can always $apt-cache search broadcom and try to find something more specific for you.
This is just a gigabit onboard wired ethernet.
Yes, reading up on it, but I've attempted to compile the driver by hand without success.
